title: DLCQ Bound States of N =(2,2) Super-Yang-Mills at Finite and Large N
abstract: We consider the 1+1 dimensional N = (2,2) supersymmetric matrix model which is obtained by dimensionally reducing N = 1 super Yang-Mills from four to two dimensions. The gauge groups we consider are U(Nc) and SU(Nc), where Nc is finite but arbitrary. We adopt light-cone coordinates, and choose to work in the light-cone gauge. Quantizing this theory via Discretized Light-Cone Quantization (DLCQ) introduces an integer, K, which restricts the light-cone momentum-fraction of constituent quanta to be integer multiples of 1/K. Solutions to the DLCQ bound state equations are obtained for K=2,3,...,6 by discretizing the light-cone supercharges, which results in a supersymmetric spectrum. Our numerical results imply the existence of normalizable massless states in the continuum limit K -> infinity, and therefore the absence of a mass gap. The low energy spectrum is dominated by string-like (or many parton) states. Our results are consistent with the claim that the theory is in a screening phase.
